definition: broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of

sentences.english: My aunt was surprised and hoped it was not some Freemason affair.
sentences.chinese: 舅媽有些驚訝，她希望不會又是共濟會的什麼破事。

sentences.english: To settle a simple matter like this won't take more than two minutes.
sentences.chinese: 這點破事兩分鐘就辦完了。

sentences.english: You are putting out the most negative shit in the world.
sentences.chinese: 你在把最消極的破事抖出來給大家看。

definition: lit. chicken feathers and garlic skins (idiom)/fig. trivial (matter)
one's employment/business/matter that needs to be settled/(northern dialect) (of a person) demanding/trying/troublesome/erhua variant of 事[shi4]/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1]
lit. stale grain, overcooked sesame (idiom); fig. the same boring old gossip
pinyin: chen2 gu3 zi5 lan4 zhi1 ma5

definition: everything in disorder (idiom)/in a hideous mess/obscene/dirty/filthy
to be vexed or annoyed/to feel queasy
